columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL
columns.description: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The date of this contact in calendar format.

columns.name: CM_CT_OWNER_ID
columns.description: The Community ID (CID) of the instance that owns this contact. This is only populated if you use IntraConnect.

columns.name: TXP_ABS_CIND_C_NAME
columns.description: Absolute contraindications, which cause a transplant patient to be denied a transplant.
entries: Significant untreatable coronary artery disease or left ventricular dysfunction
ABO type and screen incompatibility between recipient and donor
Stage 3 + fibrosis confirmed by liver biopsy
Mean pulmonary artery pressure > 35 mm Hg
Transient ischemic attack or stroke within the past 6 months
Psycho-social instability or an unsupportive social environment
A medical condition associated with poor long-term survival
Inadequate control of carbohydrate or lipid metabolism, if diabetic
Irreversible organ failure without possibility of transplantation
Myocardial infarction in last 3 months, unable to correct lesion
No evidence of acceptable venous perfusion source
Organic brain syndrome, dementing illness, disabling psych/neurologic condition
Other diseases or conditions that could make the transplant unsuccessful
Severe underlying cardiopulmonary or systemic disease
Complications of AIDS such as opportunistic infections or neoplasm
Lack of well-defined secondary complications of diabetes
Uncontrolled HIV/AIDS infection defined as detectable HIV-1 RNA (viral load)
